comment._content: Yes, a drawing--and appears to be SS France (1912).

comment.author: 83117903@N00
comment._content:
Is that Leo di Caprio at the bow exclaiming, "I'm king of the world!"?

A very fine ship drawing.

comment.author: 8947617@N06
comment._content: This picture reminded me of the titanic. The date of this picture is also in the same time period. I agree, this picture definitely looks like an artist's perception of the ship.

comment.author: 22968943@N05
comment._content: The Titanic? How dare you sir besmirch the honor of France's maritime traditions by drawing parallels to that horrible English ship!-)

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content:
Launched 10 September 191,0 completed 1912.
Tonnage:23,769 gross tons
Length:713 ft (217 m)
Beam:78 ft 4 in (23.9 m)
Propulsion:Four direct-action steam turbines; Quadruple Screw; 45,000 ihp (34,000 kW)
Speed:23.50 knots (attained a speed of 25.09 knots (46.47 km/h) on her trials)
Capacity:1,623 passengers
